notes: The net travels at a speed of 900
With the maximum cast range and radius, Earthbind can hit units up to 720/970/1220/1470 range away

Roots the targets, preventing them from moving and casting certain mobility abilities
 Provides True Sight and shared vision over the targets

The net provides 300 radius flying vision around itself as it travels
 This vision does not last
Fully affects invisible units and units inside the Fog of War

TALENT NOTES The True Strike on targets [picture:talent_tree_symbol] talent immediately updates all currently existing Earthbind debuffs Attacks against the affected target have absolute accuracy, which prevents its attacks from being missed (i.e evasion or blind effects)
abilities.description: Tosses a net at the target point, rooting down all enemy units in an area around it.
abilities.name: Earthbind
abilities.story: Catching dinner in the Riftshadow Ruins can be quite the task.

notes:
Poof can only be cast on self, clones and illusions of the caster
 ↓↓ Double-tapping automatically targets self
 To Poof to invulnerable or hidden targets, it has to be unit-targeted to Poof to the target
 When ground-targeted, the Meepo closest to the target point is chosen upon cast, which can be the same Meepo who casts Poof
Does not disjoint projectiles

Poof deals its damage once at the cast location and once at the destination point
 The damage from Poof stacks, so enemies within the cast location and destination point effectively take double the damage

Can deal up to the following amount of damage (before reductions) when a certain number of Meepos casts it at the same spot: 1x [picture:meepo_minimap]: 80/120/160/200 ([picture:talent_tree_symbol] 140/180/220/260) 2x [picture:meepo_minimap]: 160/240/320/400 ([picture:talent_tree_symbol] 280/360/440/520) 3x [picture:meepo_minimap]: 240/360/480/600 ([picture:talent_tree_symbol] 420/540/660/780) 4x [picture:meepo_minimap]: 320/480/640/800 ([picture:talent_tree_symbol] 560/720/880/1040) 5x [picture:meepo_minimap]: 400/600/800/1000 ([picture:talent_tree_symbol] 700/900/1100/1300) SPELL STEAL This ability's cast point is not modified when acquired
abilities.description: Drawing mystical energies from the earth, a Meepo can teleport to another Meepo or itself after channeling for 1.5 seconds, dealing damage in both the departure and arrival locations.
abilities.name: Poof
abilities.story: Sometimes breaking one of the Riftshadow Crystals can be just the trick for getting yourself out of a bind. Or your other self.

notes: Ransack first deals its health steal as pure damage, heals Meepo, then deals attack damage
Treat [picture:animal_courier_radiant_minimap] Couriers and illusions as heroes, and creep-heroes as creeps

The bonus damage is dealt in a separate damage instance, and counts as spell damage
 This means it is not affected or considered by anything that works with attack damage
 It is fully affected by spell damage amplification and spell lifesteal

Heals all Meepos, including the attacking Meepo, excluding illusions, by a set amount
 Always heals for the full amount per attack, regardless of how much damage the target actually takes
 The heal counts as lifesteal, so that it is affected by lifesteal manipulation, but not by heal manipulation
Does not work against [picture:roshan] Roshan and on allies
abilities.description: Steals health from the enemy with each strike and heals all other Meepos for that amount.
abilities.name: Ransack
abilities.story: So you gonna need that, or...?

notes: Requires [picture:aghanim's_scepter] Aghanim's Scepter to be unlocked
Applies a basic dispel on the caster upon cast
Stuns the caster for the duration, and turns them invulnerable and hidden
Restores health in the form of health regeneration, increasing it by 12.5% of max health per second
abilities.description: Digs into the ground, dispelling Meepo and causing him to become invulnerable and untargetable for 4 seconds. Restores 50% of his max health over that duration. Can't be cast while rooted.
abilities.name: Dig

notes: Unlike most other ultimates, Divided We Stand can be leveled up at level 4/11/18 instead of 6/12/18
Upon leveling, the Meepo clones always spawn with full health and mana next to Meepo Prime, even when leveling from a clone

Meepo and his clones are represented each by an icon with health and mana bars for each on the top left corner of the screen
 When a Meepo is selected, its icon becomes brighter
 When a Meepo takes damage, its icon blinks red
The 26 seconds min respawn time does not apply to Meepo if a clone dies to neutral creeps

Clones benefit from [picture:talent_tree_symbol] talents bonuses, and from any attributes granted by items or buffs However, they do not benefit from any other stats from item bonuses (damage, health, armor, etc.) The bonuses of [picture:attribute_bonus] Attribute Bonus and strength talent, and [picture:power_treads] Power Treads are not copied When Meepo Prime loses attributes (e.g to [picture:decay] Decay or [picture:glaives_of_wisdom] Glaives of Wisdom), the clones' attributes adapt However, Meepo Clones themselves are still subject to attribute loss and the other Meepos do not adapt to a clone losing attributes

Increases Meepo and his clones' magic resistance to 32.5%/36.25%/40%
 Stacks multiplicatively with other sources of magic resistance
When Meepo respawns with Reincarnation, all clones respawn next to the Meepo Prime, and not at their death location

SHARD NOTES Adds an active component to Divided We Stand with the passive component still present
 Can only be cast if there is another Meepo (clone or illusion) within 300 range of the casting Meepo
 Does not count already flung Meepos, so two Meepos together cannot fling each other at the same time
 The Meepo within that enables the cast plays a throw animation, but does not have any of its actions interrupted
 When cast, releases a projectile onto the target, which travels at a speed of 1000
 The casting Meepo also gets moved along with the projectile
 While being moved, the Meepo is fully disabled, untargetable and invulnerable
 If the movement gets interrupted, the Meepo is no longer disabled, untargetable and invulnerable
 The Meepo stops moving along with the projectile if it gets disjointed, if the distance between him and the target exceeds 2200, or when the Meepo dies
 However, once the projectile impacts, the Meepo still gets instantly teleported to its location
 The projectile first applies the damage, then the debuff

TALENT NOTES The number of clone increasing [picture:talent_tree_symbol] talent automatically grants the extra Meepo clone, and does not require Divided We Stand to be leveled SPELL STEAL This ability is not acquirable
abilities.description: Meepo summons an imperfect, semi-autonomous duplicate of himself, which can gain gold and experience as he does and shares his experience, attributes and abilities. However, the clones cannot wield any items but the boots that Meepo himself wears. If any of the clones die, they all die. Divided We Stand grants all Meepos bonus Magic Resistance.
abilities.name: Divided We Stand

notes: Requires the level 25 [picture:talent_tree_symbol] talent learned to be unlocked

The Pack Rat [picture:talent_tree_symbol] talent allows Meepo to equip regular items in the designated neutral items slot If [picture:divided_we_stand] Divided We Stand is not learned, Meepo cannot equip items in the neutral items slot Divided We Stand item interactions notes fully apply
When [picture:boots_of_speed] Boots of Speed-based items are transferred to the neutral items slot, it is now considered a neutral item, and therefore not copied

Does not transfer items to the neutral items slot when the inventory or backpack slots are full
 Regular items in the neutral item slot can be disassembled and are also considered components for item combining or upgrading
 Regular items in the neutral item slot also do not have the Transfer to Stash function

The following items are not transferable to the neutral items slot: [picture:aegis_of_the_immortal] Aegis of the Immortal, [picture:divine_rapier] Divine Rapier and [picture:gem_of_true_sight] Gem of True Sight
abilities.description: Can equip any item in the neutral slot.
abilities.name: Pack Rat

description: Five are stronger than one. Divided They Stand, united they fall, where there is one Meepo, expect to see more as they Poof towards each other for aid. Scattering his clones throughout the battlefield, The Meepos Bind their foes to the earth, smashing them with their shovels into the ground, Ransacking their vitality for themselves. Although an individual shovel-wielding Meepo is relatively harmless and may Dig into the ground for their own safety, a swarm of angry Meepos can overwhelm even the mightiest of heroes.  Carry Escape Nuker Disabler Initiator Pusher ★★★
trivia: Several of Meepo's lines reference the Scout from Team Fortress 2, another title by Valve. Link▶️ "Aww, didn't mean to hurt ya. Much." is referring to Scout's line "Oh, I'm sorry, I didn't mean to hit ya... No, wait, yeah I did." Link▶️ "I'm not even winded.", Link▶️ "Who's the tough guy now, tough guy?", Link▶️ "Freakin' unbelievable.", Link▶️ "This is a real freakin' embarrasment.", Link▶️ "No, seriously, you all suck!" and Link▶️ "Now that's what I'm talking about!" are direct quotes from Scout. His death lines Link▶️ Link▶️ "Hey, that hurt." are a reference to Scout's lines upon evading bullets while under the effect of his Bonk! Atomic Punch (as heard here and here). Link▶️ "You suck!" is also a line used frequently by the Scout. In his anger lines Link▶️ and Link▶️, he's mumbling "You've got to be kidding me", another line frequently used by the Scout. His death line Link▶️ "You punched out all of my blood!" is a quote from the Scout in the shortfilm Meet the Sandvich.[1] With Link▶️ "Ahh now that's the stuff!", he's also quoting one of the Demoman's lines, another character from Team Fortress 2 (as heard here).
Link▶️ "Aww, didn't mean to hurt ya. Much." is referring to Scout's line "Oh, I'm sorry, I didn't mean to hit ya... No, wait, yeah I did."

Link▶️ "I'm not even winded.", Link▶️ "Who's the tough guy now, tough guy?", Link▶️ "Freakin' unbelievable.", Link▶️ "This is a real freakin' embarrasment.", Link▶️ "No, seriously, you all suck!" and Link▶️ "Now that's what I'm talking about!" are direct quotes from Scout.
His death lines Link▶️ Link▶️ "Hey, that hurt." are a reference to Scout's lines upon evading bullets while under the effect of his Bonk! Atomic Punch (as heard here and here).
Link▶️ "You suck!" is also a line used frequently by the Scout.
In his anger lines Link▶️ and Link▶️, he's mumbling "You've got to be kidding me", another line frequently used by the Scout.
His death line Link▶️ "You punched out all of my blood!" is a quote from the Scout in the shortfilm Meet the Sandvich.[1]
With Link▶️ "Ahh now that's the stuff!", he's also quoting one of the Demoman's lines, another character from Team Fortress 2 (as heard here).
Meepo is named after the first kobold players meet in The Sunless Citadel Dungeons and Dragons 3.0 adventure.[2]
history: "If you ask me, life is all about who you know and what you can find. When you live up in the Riftshadow Ruins, just finding food can be tough. So you need to cut corners, you need to scrounge, you need to know your strengths. Some of the beasts up there can kill you, so you need a way to trap the weak and duck the strong. On the upside, the ruins have history, and history is worth a lot to some people. There used to be a palace there, where they had all these dark rituals. Bad stuff. If you survived the ceremony, they would shatter a crystal and split your soul into pieces. They made great art though! Sculptures and such. Let me tell you: sometimes you stumble onto some of those old carvings. Take a pack full of those to town and sell them, then get yourself food for a few weeks. If luck is really on your side, you might find a Riftshadow crystal. Get it appraised and start asking around. Someone always knows some crazy fool looking for this kind of thing. If all else fails, sell it to a Magus the next time one's in town. They love that stuff. Still, whatever you do, be careful handling those crystals. You do not want one to go off on you. It really hurts."

hero_talents.talent_left: Earthbind grants True Strike on Targets

notes: Talents are fully copied by the Meepo Clones.
The strength talent effectively grants Meepo 120 health and 0.6 health regeneration bonus.
The evasion talent stacks multiplicatively with other sources of evasion.
